Class WhitePlayer

java.lang.Object
engine.forPlayer.Player
engine.forPlayer.WhitePlayer
public final class WhitePlayer extends Player
The WhitePlayer class represents a player controlling the white pieces in a chess game. It extends the abstract Player class and provides functionality specific to white pieces, including move generation, castling validation, and piece management. This class is responsible for generating legal moves for the white player and handling special moves such as castling.

The white player follows standard chess rules where pieces move from the bottom of the board toward the top, with pawns advancing toward the eighth rank for promotion.

Author:
Aaron, dareTo81

  • Constructor Details

    • WhitePlayer

      public WhitePlayer(Board board, Collection<Move> whiteStandardLegals, Collection<Move> blackStandardLegals)
      Constructs a WhitePlayer object with the given chessboard and collections of legal moves for both white and black players. The player is initialized with access to the current board state and legal move sets for position evaluation.
      Parameters:
      board - The current chess board state.
      whiteStandardLegals - A collection of legal moves for the white player.
      blackStandardLegals - A collection of legal moves for the black player.

  • Method Details

    • calculateKingCastles

      protected Collection<Move> calculateKingCastles(Collection<Move> playerLegals, Collection<Move> opponentLegals)
      Calculates and returns the possible king-side and queen-side castling moves for the white player. A castling move is legal only when specific conditions are met including unmoved king and rook, clear path between pieces, no check situations, and absence of king pawn traps. The method validates both king-side and queen-side castling opportunities according to chess rules.

      King-side castling requires the king to move from e1 to g1 and the rook from h1 to f1. Queen-side castling requires the king to move from e1 to c1 and the rook from a1 to d1.

      Specified by:
      calculateKingCastles in class Player
      Parameters:
      playerLegals - A collection of legal moves for the white player.
      opponentLegals - A collection of legal moves for the black player.
      Returns:
      A collection of possible castling moves for the white player, which may be empty.

    • getOpponent

      public BlackPlayer getOpponent()
      Gets the opponent of the white player, which is the black player in the chess game. This method provides access to the opposing player for game state evaluation and move calculation purposes.
      Specified by:
      getOpponent in class Player
      Returns:
      The BlackPlayer object representing the opponent.

    • getActivePieces

      public Collection<Piece> getActivePieces()
      Gets a collection of active white pieces on the current chess board. Active pieces are those that remain on the board and have not been captured. This collection is used for move generation and board evaluation.
      Specified by:
      getActivePieces in class Player
      Returns:
      A collection of Piece objects representing the active white pieces.

    • getAlliance

      public Alliance getAlliance()
      Gets the alliance of the white player, which is always Alliance.WHITE. This method identifies the player's color for game logic and rule enforcement.
      Specified by:
      getAlliance in class Player
      Returns:
      The Alliance enum value representing the white player's alliance.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the white player's alliance. The representation matches the alliance's string format for display purposes.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The string "WHITE" to represent the white player.
